verbs.description: imn threat and the state monopoly of violence by richard murphy those backing imn in the hope that [ARG0: they] [V: speak] [ARG1: for human rights] must endeavor to get the larger picture the kind of protests imn holds in nigeria are not permissible in any other country not even in the united states or united kingdom that some people see as the replication of heaven on earth molotov cocktail united kingdom israel revolutionary guards murphy sahara reporters imn united states amnesty international nnamdi kanu nigeria richard murphy islamic movement islamic movement of uzbekistan
